story.title: Running From Him - Episode 4
story.storyDescription: Avery has a secret that she’s hiding from her handsome new boss, Ethan. She doesn’t realize that Ethan has a secret of his own.
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Zoey Hughes lives in Seattle, where she enjoys writing, reading and watching bad reality TV.

story.prePaywallNotification: Why is Avery living in her car? Ethan is about to find out in RUNNING FROM HIM.
story.postPaywallNotification: What caused Avery to finally leave Luke?! Keep reading RUNNING FROM HIM.

messages.text: Avery’s car door lets out a loud screech.
Avery throws her arms up and sinks into the seat.
Ethan jerks back, realizing he’s startled her.
Avery! It’s okay. It’s me. It’s Ethan.
Avery drops her hands
Sorry, I thought you might be—
Thought I might be who?
No one specific.
I don’t buy it.
You’re sleeping in a car.
You want to be paid in cash.
You look like you haven’t eaten in days.
Avery looks like she’s shrinking, somehow.
Ethan realizes how aggressive he must have sounded.
He lowers his voice.
Who are you running from?
I don’t want to talk about it, okay?
She’s near tears.
Calm down, okay? We’ll figure this out.
Grab your stuff.
Why?
I’m not leaving you in a car in a shady neighborhood.
Get whatever’s important to you and a change of clothes. I’ll carry it.
Avery shoves together a small bag, and then climbs out of the car.
Her face is red, and her shoulders slump.
Ethan takes the bag and they return silently to his apartment.
He locks the door behind them.
They sit down on opposite ends of the couch.
He doesn’t say a word, just sits. And waits.
Finally Avery speaks.
His name was Luke.
We met when I was a sophomore at UCLA.
He was interning for a law firm.
It was like…it was like being seen for the first time.
What do you mean?
My mom passed away a few years ago.
My parents were the happily-ever-after couple, you know?
So when she died, my dad kinda turned into a ghost.
Or…maybe I was the ghost. It was like my dad couldn’t even see me.
College was my chance to find myself. It was where I belonged.
And then Luke found me.
Do you know how easy it is to fall in love when no one has noticed you in years?
At first it was amazing.
He told me I was perfect.
That he’d stay up late thinking of me. He’d call and text.
He sent me so many flowers, my dorm looked like a florist’s shop.
I think about it now, and hindsight makes it so clear.
But it wasn’t then.
The first year was a little suffocating, maybe.
But I thought it was love.
Then it started to twist into something else.
He’d get mad if I had a study partner who was a guy.
He’d ask me why it took a half-hour to respond to his texts.
He started telling me how much he hated my roommate, how she was a bad influence.
And so we moved in together.
And then it got…god it got so much worse.
Avery lets out a sob.
Ethan moves next to her and pulls her against him.
Avery clears her throat and continues talking.
It wasn’t like he hit me out of nowhere, you know?
It was like we built up to that moment.
We’d argue and I’d want to leave and he’d block the door.
Or, like, we’d be arguing and he’d push me, and I’d trip over something.
By the time he got really abusive…
Ethan starts gently finger-combing her hair.
ALL of those things are abuse.
He doesn’t have to hit you with a fist to be abusive.
I know. I guess.
Avery. I mean it. There’s no excuse for what he did.
He should’ve made you feel safe. Not afraid.
Have you ever heard that stupid joke —  “How do you eat an elephant?”
The punch line is, “One bite at a time.”
That’s how I ended up being the girl who realized her fiancé was going to kill her.
It built up, one tiny, tiny thing at a time.
A word, a push, a threat.
There is a long silence.
Jesus. I’m so sorry he did that to you.
He’s going to kill me if he finds me. The night I left…
He had a gun. I tried to break up with him, and the next thing I knew, he had a gun.
I think he bought it just to shoot me.
We’d hit a rough patch.
I’d threatened to break up with him a couple of times.
Looking back I think he had a plan.
I went out with my friends for dinner.
I was gone two hours, and he was blowing up my phone with texts and calls.
And I knew that night that I had to end it.
I hadn’t seen my best friends in like three months, because of him.
And that night I realized how screwed up everything was.
So I went home and I told him it was over.
And the next thing I knew, there was this gun.
And for a long time, I was staring down the barrel of a gun.
And I thought for sure I was about to die.
But he pulled the trigger, and…it just clicked.
I don’t know if the safety was still on.
Or if he hadn’t loaded it properly.
But for one second, he got distracted.
So I kicked him and ran.
And this was three weeks ago?
Yes. I pawned my engagement ring.
I drove for an hour.
Then I got all the cash I could from an ATM machine and threw away my card.
I knew I’d run out of money, and have no choice except to use the card.
And then he’d find me.
And you ended up here.
Yeah. I ran out of money. And gas.
And then I saw your Now Hiring sign.
And that’s why you begged me for a job.
I don’t even have enough in the tank to make it to the next town.
You were my last chance. If you’d said no…
It probably doesn’t even matter that you’re on my side.
He’s not going to let me go.
He’s a prosecuting attorney, for god’s sake.
His best friend is a detective.
It’s only a matter of time before he finds me.
